summary: A small Player House Near Whiterun.
descriptionHtml:
[b][u]Long Description
[/u][/b]Located just south of Whiterun on the creek StoneLodge is a small Dwemer themed home complete with all almost all the crafting and storage an inspiring DragonBorn could need.

[b][u]Features
[/u][/b]The house is located just East of the Whiterun stables and South Whiterun hold proper, it has a map marker near the front door and will deposit you directly in front of it upon fast travel. There's no lock on the door but the marker must be discovered first before you can fast travel to it. 

Fully nav-meshed and Tes5edit cleaned it has no scripts so it's safe to install/un-install at any time.

The house has a smelter just outside on the side of the house complete with its own named storage container.
The inside has just about every base crafting station including a wood chopping block (axe included), cooking pot, sharpening wheel, tanning rack, enchanting table, alchemy lab, armor tempering table, and a smithing anvil. In addition each station has it's own named storage. There is also a twin bed which grants a rested bonus.
There are also 6 more named storage containers on the wall along side the bed for everything from armor and weapons to all those quest items you don't really know what to do with once you've completed their perspective quest lines.

There is some clutter inside to give it a lived in feel but it is all static and shout proof, i kept everything to a minimum to make sure there was as little loading lag as possible. Everything is vanilla pathed so it will automatically match whatever texture overhauls your using. 

[b][u]Known Bugs
[/u][/b]I used the base games books and armor to create some of the static clutter which will throw a warning upon loading in CK (Creation Kit), it has no effect ingame, it's just CK gets annoyed when you convert some non-static items to static.

[b][u]Installation and un-installation
[/u][/b]There's no scripts so it's safe to uninstall at any time, just remember to remove any items you want to keep or they'll be lost forever if you leave them behind.
author: Tarskar
